title: Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing Recipe
description: This delicious spinach salad with warm bacon dressing is loaded with eggs, mushrooms, cheese, and almonds for an impressive, restaurant-style appetizer.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Green Salad Recipes Spinach Salad Recipes Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing 4.7 (354) 265 Reviews 24 Photos This warm spinach salad with bacon dressing is a classic restaurant-style dish. It looks and tastes like a lot of work, but can be prepared in no time!  Submitted by brightlightz Updated on November 15, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 24 24 24 24 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (10 ounce) bag baby spinach leaves 10 ounces Swiss cheese, shredded 4 hard-cooked eggs, peeled and sliced 1 cup sliced mushrooms 4 strips crisply cooked bacon, crumbled ½ cup toasted sliced almonds 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 large shallot, minced 1 teaspoon garlic, minced ⅓ cup white wine vinegar ⅓ cup Dijon mustard ⅓ cup honey 2 strips crisply cooked bacon, crumbled salt and pepper to taste Directions Place spinach into a large serving bowl; top with Swiss cheese, hard-cooked eggs, mushrooms, 4 crumbled strips of bacon, and almonds. Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Stir in shallots and garlic; cook and stir until shallots are softened, about 2 minutes. Whisk in vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, and 2 crumbled strips of bacon until heated through; season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour hot dressing over spinach and toss to coat. Recipe Tip This salad can easily be converted to a main dish salad by adding strips of grilled chicken breast. I Made It Print 1,429 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 663 Calories 41g Fat 40g Carbs 36g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 663 % Daily Value * Total Fat 41g 52% Saturated Fat 17g 86% Cholesterol 293mg 98% Sodium 1123mg 49% Total Carbohydrate 40g 15% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 26g Protein 36g 72% Vitamin C 22mg 25% Calcium 700mg 54% Iron 3mg 19% Potassium 788mg 17% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing 01 of 24 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 24 Photo by  Kristina Siffring-lloyd 11/11/2022 First off i did use honey ginger white balsamic vinegar in place of wine vinegar. I really enjoyed this salad. Paired perfect with pork chops. 03 of 24 Photo by  Tish 01/08/2021 04 of 24 Photo by  Karen Brown Eakins 06/14/2020 Although I like mustard, I found it too spicy so would make again with maybe half of the mustard. 05 of 24 Photo by  lindad 05/23/2020 06 of 24 Photo by  CourtneyMendiola 02/11/2020 07 of 24 Photo by  Mike 01/01/2020 08 of 24 Photo by  shelldawn 12/08/2019 Sooo good, I don't really measure except when baking and after reading the other reviews I added the vinegar, honey and dijon to taste. Plus knowing it wouldn't keep well and it's just me I tossed the salad and stored it and the dressing separately. I ate it as a side to my steak but I can think of so many things to so with this! 09 of 24 Photo by  Cheryll 10/26/2019 10 of 24 Photo by  rjv4EVER 05/31/2019 This is my second attempt. The first batch was amazing, but it was really spicy due to the mustard and vinegar. This go-round, I diluted the vinegar with water and used a spicy mustard dijonaise (instead of the standard Dijon mustard). Now it doesn’t have that much kick, so next time I’ll make some more tweaks, but still it’s a great, hearty salad. Also I deleted the nuts and cheese and instead added thinly sliced red onions and cherry tomatoes. Also, buy quality bacon....it really makes or breaks your salad. My favorite is Trader Joe’s Baccon. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Sausage-Stuffed Eggplant 283 Ratings Wilted Spinach Salad 125 Ratings Strawberry, Spinach, and Pear Salad 24 Ratings Strawberry Romaine Salad 314 Ratings Spinach Watermelon Salad 69 Ratings My Favorite Beet Salad 102 Ratings Spinach Salad with Peaches and Pecans 149 Ratings Nicole's Balsamic Beet and Fresh Spinach Salad 12 Ratings Brunch Spinach Salad 26 Ratings Flat Iron Steak and Spinach Salad 89 Ratings Grilled Peach Salad with Spinach and Raspberries Steak and Spinach Salad 76 Ratings Spinach Pomegranate Salad 134 Ratings Beautiful Salad 355 Ratings Rhubarb Spinach Salad 7 Ratings Mexican Chicken and Black Bean Salad 71 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: brightlightz
instructions: Place spinach into a large serving bowl; top with Swiss cheese, hard-cooked eggs, mushrooms, 4 crumbled strips of bacon, and almonds.;Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Stir in shallots and garlic; cook and stir until shallots are softened, about 2 minutes. Whisk in vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, and 2 crumbled strips of bacon until heated through; season to taste with salt and pepper.;Pour hot dressing over spinach and toss to coat.
